issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When we try to use the grouping function at the end of a result via solrj with the parameter group.main=true, 
an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is raised.

For instance, on a result containing 3 groups, if the start & rows parameters are equal to 2 & 5 respectively.

I will attach a patch.

comments.body: A test unit and a correction.

author.name: martijn.v.groningen
author.emailAddress: martijn dot v dot groningen at gmail dot com

comments.body: Hi Ludovic. I've tried running the attached patch on both trunk and 3.6 branch without the fix in Grouping.java, but the test doesn't fail. Is something missing in the test? Can you maybe attach a stacktrace?

updateAuthor.name: martijn.v.groningen
updateAuthor.emailAddress: martijn dot v dot groningen at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Hi Martijn,

I'm not at my office today (vacations), so I tried to reproduce at home and you are right, 
the test not does not fail on my home computer...

That's strange, I will try to compare the two environments to understand this behavior.

thx,

Ludovic.

I finally manage to reproduce with the start value equal to 4.

And here is the stacktrace :
